Installation¶

General Requirement¶

Python 3.5 or higher is required, better with matplotlib installed.

Windows user¶

Download Python from python.org. During the installation, be sure that pip has been shipped and installed on your PC.

After installation or already installed:

  1. optional Check if matplotlib is installed, if not, in cmd, type:pip install matplotlib. About 100MB is required. This enables the graphic output.
  2. Collect Phyco package from github.
  3. Unzip the package if needed.

Unix user¶

Python are usually shipped with your OS, but check your version first. It’s most likely to be Python 3.4 or/and 2.7. But they either don’t meet the requirement. You may replace it or make an altinstall. To do so

  1. Download python source release from python.org.
  2. In terminal, switch your working directory to where you downloaded python source.
  3. Unzip the file by typing tar -xvf Python-3.5.1.tar.xz #sample name
  4. Follow the ordinary installation steps (refer to readme in the folder)
./configure
make
make test
sudo make install #sudo make altinstall
  1. If git is installed: switch the folder you want and type git clone https://github.com/Chengifei/PhycoE.git. If not, just download Phyco from github
  2. optional Check if matplotlib is installed, if not, in cmd, type:pip install matplotlib. About 100MB is required. This enables the graphic output.

Mac User¶

This program hasn’t been tested on Mac OS, but it should work properly. For instructions refer to Unix user.
